text: Steve Hopkins (Composer) Steve Hopkins, also known as Steven E. Hopkins and HipHopkins, is a music composer, producer and musician based in Los Angeles, California, United States. He is best known as co-writer of the theme music for the longest running daytime drama in history, General Hospital (ABC / Disney). == Awards and nominations == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! He started off playing drums professionally at the age of 16 in the casino showrooms of Atlantic City New Jersey, where he had to be escorted to & from the stage by security guards because he was too young to be in a casino. He eventually ended up touring extensively (as a musician) with Chuck Berry, Tennessee Ernie Ford, Florence Henderson, and Gloria Loring, before re- locating to California and re-inventing himself as a composer & producer. ==References== Steve Hopkins at Internet Movie Database ==External links== * * Category:Living people Category:American television composers Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
